bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, January 22, 1942

div1.p: Kellogg sends Hench a South American magazine with a yellow fever article emphasizing Finlay's work.

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, January 22, 1942

opener.dateline:
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
257 CORNELISON AVENUE
JERSEY CITY, N.J.
January 22, 1942.

div1.p:
The children are delighted with the
salt water taffey. It was very thought of you.

Under separate cover I am sending you
a February 1942 copy of NORTE, a South American class
magazine which on pages 42-43 contains a story on
Yellow Fever. As yet I have not had this translated
but I am sure that you will find it interesting.
Naturally they played up Finlay but we expect that
for South American consumption.

Incidentally Mr. Cornwell tells me he
ran into you in the Library of the Surgeon General
and he said that you looked tired. Perhaps you need
a little of that advice which physicians so frequently
give their patients. More rest.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, George A. Kellogg Dr. Philip S Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester
Minnesota
GAK:L
Note has a circulation
of about 30,000 all over S. A.
